reviews.review_msg: Ronda made Shakespeare enjoyable. She picked a great selection of plays and focused on the texts themselves, rather than critical theory. This lecture-style made the task of talking about Shakespeare less daunting. Her papers were typical of the third year level. She gives you a choice on what to write on. Not a difficult marker, just picky.

This was one of my favourite classes I ever took. Ronda was such a good lecturer and fantastic at creating student discussion. She came well prepared with engaging lecture content and was always very clear in her expectations. She answers emails fast and encouraged people to come to office hours, where she gave very good feedback on papers.

She would sometimes have scattered ideas and be all over the place during lectures sometimes, but would be helpful a lot of the time. A lot of lectures don't focus on works themselves, but around other things like movie adaptations which added enjoyment. However, they weren't really helpful for the course.

Dr. G is an excellent professor. Show him respect and join in the discussion. He wants students to learn and have ideas, not just sit there say nothing. He marks papers fairly and offers really good feedback. His knowledge of and enthusiasm for Shakespeare is refreshing. He has great energy, so go on take the class!

He's passionate and extremely knowledgeable about Shakespeare, and as far as facilitating class discussion, he does that well. He's a tough marker though (do NOT take his term paper proposals lightly - although they're not worth much, he takes them more seriously than you would think). Overall nice guy, but I wish he would go easier on the marking.

The fact that this is the third class I've taken with him says something about how much I enjoy his class. Make sure to write in your books as much as you can, as all the exams I've taken with him have been open book with notes allowed as long as they're written in the book (you can use post-its too). Marks papers a little on the tougher side.

Tied with Everton for best English prof at SFU. Has the ability to make a four-hour night class relatively entertaining which is a definite plus. Fair grader, great sense of humour... wouldn't hestitate to take another course with him.

Yes, Paul Budra has a cocky air about him, but he's surprisingly modest and kind to ignorant arrogant remarks from students; in fact, he seems to encourage them. His lecture style is clearly engaging and fun, but he goes too quickly for the complex, more important things, and not quickly enough for the less. Still, one of the best at SFU.
I enjoyed Paul's class more than any other at SFU. He has an awsome sense of humour, a vast knowledge of material and is extremely approachable. If at all possible take a class with him!!!

has got to be the best prof in the engl dept. and no, it's not cause i think he's 'hot'. he made shakespeare fun and his classes were NEVER boring. lectures are 9:30 in the morn & taped, but i always went cause it was just so entertaining as well as intellectually stimilating ofcourse. he's also very helpful w/ emails and concerns. he sais ew alot.
A great professor!  He made Shakespeare fun and interesting.
Great prof, i heard he used to be a stand up comic! Need i say more
Budra rocks! Amazing lecturer, great tutorials, funny, and sexy too!
